name: NexusIqPipelineTask
description: The Nexus IQ for Azure DevOps extension provides full component intelligence and the ability to run policy against your application.
author: SonatypeIntegrations

inputs.name: nexusIqService
inputs.label: Nexus IQ Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Nexus IQ endpoint to use. If needed, click on 'manage', and add a new [Nexus IQ service connection](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/library/service-endpoints?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml#sep-generic) and fill in the IQ server details

inputs.name: organizationId
inputs.label: Organization ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the IQ Organization ID. This determines the organization under which the application will be created in case the application doesn't exist and the automatic application creation configuration is enabled.

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the IQ Application ID. Determines the policy elements (policies, labels, and license threat groups) to associate with this build, and is managed via the Nexus IQ Server

inputs.name: stage
inputs.label: Stage
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls the stage the policy evaluation will be run against on the Nexus IQ Server

inputs.name: scanTargets
inputs.label: Scan Targets
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of [Ant-style patterns](http://ant.apache.org/manual/dirtasks.html#patterns) relative to the workspace root that denote the files/archives to be scanned, e.g. `**/target/*.war`, `**/target/*.ear`.

inputs.name: ignoreSystemError
inputs.label: Ignore IQ Server's System Errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls the build outcome if there is a failure in communicating with the Nexus IQ Server (e.g. network outage). If checked, the build will be marked as warning. Otherwise, the build is marked as failed.

inputs.name: javaSystemProperties
inputs.label: Java System Properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Command line parameters for Java System Properties. e.g. -Djava.net.useSystemProxies=false

inputs.name: enableDebugLogging
inputs.label: Enable Debug Logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enables debug logging for IQ policy evaluation. This should be used only to troubleshoot any problem you may have when scanning a repository.
